name: Sara's Beef Jerky
author: Sara
summary: This is a great way to make beef jerky at home without the use of a smoker or dehydrator. Just pop the meat in your oven and eight hours later you've got delicious jerky. Ask your butcher to slice the meat for you.
ingredients: 1 ½ pounds sirloin OR London broil, cut to 1/8 inch thick slices
directions: Preheat oven to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C)
In a medium, nonporous bowl, combine the salt, liquid smoke, garlic powder, monosodium glutamate, onion powder, soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce and ground black pepper to taste
Place meat slices in this mixture and coat well
Then place the meat slices onto two 10x15 inch baking dishes in a single layer
Bake at 200 degrees F (95 degrees C) for 8 hours
